column5: well i wasnt out on the river much in the last while, so the past 2 days ive been out for a few hours at a time. the water level is real low it has droped over 12 inches in the past few weeks, the water is still very cold tho. i have only been fishing depper and colder runs and pools as not to put much stress on the trout and the fishing is still great.  i got out yesterday at 4:30 pm and was out for 1 1/2 hour. in that time the fishing was great. i got lots of smaller 6-8 inch fish and a few over 12 inches. including a 14 inch beauty. the fish were caught on grass hopper imitations as there are lots in the river right now.  http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v302/pik...pg?t=1187818719 a nice one with some very nice colours  http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v302/pik...pg?t=1187818817 a very nice 14 incher which took the fly very aggresivly and one amazing fight for the size of the fish  i got out agian today for a few hours and on my second cast with the hopper i get another fish about 10 inches no pic. agian lots of other smaller ones. i decided to bring along an ultra light with me today and decided to toss out a spinner and worm. i got a nice 12 inch fish with that combo. he had some great spawning colours as well. http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v302/pik...pg?t=1187819022 all fish were released  i definatly love this type of fishing and the river has lots of action latly as well. best of all i have it all to my self   lol
What no Tinbanger and brother?Looks like you had a good time catching tasty specs.  MTP
Hey buddy, is that "THE spot" ??  You know where Im talking about if it is.  I've been getting them pretty good there this past week on hoppers as well.
